senses.de: The purpose or role something or someone does
senses.ex: The function of scissors is to cut

Tips.title: Interchangeable Roles
Tips.description: Objects or people can have more than one function depending on the context.
Tips.example: A smartphone's function isn't just to make calls but also to access the internet.

Tips.title: Not Always Obvious
Tips.description: Some functions might not be immediately apparent and require explanation.
Tips.example: Can you explain the function of this feature?

Tips.title: Beyond Physical
Tips.description: Function can refer to conceptual roles as well as physical actions.
Tips.example: In this game, your function is to solve puzzles.

senses.de: An event or gathering with a particular purpose
senses.ex: She is planning for a function at her house next weekend

Tips.title: Formality Variance
Tips.description: The word 'function' can be used for both formal occasions and casual gatherings.
Tips.example: We attended a casual function at the community center.

Tips.title: Context-Driven Use
Tips.description: The meaning of 'function' shifts depending on whether it's individual attendance or hosting.
Tips.example: Our company will organize a charity function next month.

senses.de: A mathematical relationship where a quantity depends on another
senses.ex: Y is a function of X

Tips.title: Not Always Numbers
Tips.description: Mathematical functions may involve different types of quantities, like shapes or sets.
Tips.example: In geometry, a function can map shapes to areas.

Tips.title: Real-Life Models
Tips.description: Functions in math can represent real-world relationships, such as speed and time.
Tips.example: The function shows how time affects speed.

Tips.title: General Effectiveness
Tips.description: When something functions, it meets the expectations of its role or design.
Tips.example: Even after years, the old clock still functions well.

Tips.title: Not Quite Perfect
Tips.description: Functioning doesn't always mean perfect performance; it can work with minor issues.
Tips.example: The app functions, but it's slow to load.

senses.de: A specific task performed by a part of the body or a system
senses.ex: The function of the heart is to pump blood

Tips.title: Biological Roles
Tips.description: In biology, a function often refers to life-sustaining activities or processes.
Tips.example: The function of leaves is to perform photosynthesis.

Tips.title: System Interdependence
Tips.description: The function of a body part may depend on or affect other parts within an organism.
Tips.example: Impaired lung function can affect oxygen levels in the blood.

Job.wordDefinition:
Job refers to a specific employment or task assigned to a person. For example, a job may involve working at a company or organization and completing certain tasks for a specific wage or salary.

In simpler terms, function describes the purpose of something, while job describes a specific task or employment.

Office.wordDefinition:
Function refers to the purpose or role that something has, while the word office refers to a physical workspace or a position of authority or responsibility.

For example, a computer's function is to process information, whereas an office is a designated space where people work or conduct business.

Similarly, a person may hold the function of a manager, which means they have a specific set of responsibilities, but their office may be located in a building or company headquarters.

Function is more about what something does, while an office is more about where someone works or their position within an organization.

Position.wordDefinition:
Function and position are two different words that have different meanings and are applicable in different contexts.

Position refers to the location or placement of something or someone relative to other objects or points of reference. For example, the position of a book on a shelf can be described using coordinates or landmarks.

In sports, position refers to the particular role or responsibility of a player on a team.

Function refers to purpose or role, while position refers to location or placement. Both words are applicable in various fields and contexts such as science, technology, sports, and everyday life.

Purpose.wordDefinition:
Purpose refers to the reason for which something is made or used. For example, the purpose of a knife may be to prepare food.

In simpler terms, function is what something does, while purpose is why something exists or is used. Both words can be used in various contexts, but function is more commonly used when talking about how something works, while purpose describes the intention behind its use.

Responsibility.wordDefinition:
Responsibility refers to the obligation and accountability to do something correctly or to take care of something or someone.

Both words are applicable in everyday life. Function pertains more to specific roles or tasks, while responsibility is more about the trust and obligation put on someone.

For example, a teacher's function is to educate students, while their responsibility is to make sure their students are safe and learning in a positive environment.

Role.wordDefinition:
Function and role are two words that are sometimes used interchangeably, but they have slightly different meanings.

A role is the part or position that someone or something plays in a larger system or group. For example, the role of a teacher is to educate and guide students.

We use role when we talk about what a person or thing is expected to do in a certain situation or environment.

Function refers to what something does, while role refers to the position or responsibility it has in a larger context.

Task.wordDefinition:
A task is a specific activity or action that is assigned to someone to do. For example, the task of cleaning the house might be assigned to a family member.

Functions are usually more broad and general, while tasks are more specific and detailed. Functions are applicable to describing the purpose or role of something, while tasks are applicable to describing a particular action that needs to be completed.

A function is what something does in general, while a task is a specific job or duty that needs to be done.

Use.wordDefinition:
Use refers to the act of using something for a particular purpose. For example, you can use a hammer to drive nails.

You can use a car to get to school or work.

Function is a more abstract concept that refers to the larger purpose or job of something, while use is more concrete and refers to the specific actions taken with something to achieve a goal.

quotes.Text: Government has three primary functions. It should provide for military defense of the nation. It should enforce contracts between individuals. It should protect citizens from crimes against themselves or their property.
quotes.Title: American Economist
quotes.Name: Milton Friedman

quotes.Text: My first fighting team was my brother, and I learned that I came from a community where your team was your family. We functioned as a unit. You helped as many people as you could, because they would help you.
quotes.Title: American Mixed Martial Artist
quotes.Name: Frank Shamrock

quotes.Text: I know movies are a function of our dream world. And when you project yourself on screen, it's easier to project yourself into what you were, not what you are.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Meryl Streep

quotes.Text: All this could go tomorrow, and I would still know how to function, because I never had nothing before. I went through the struggle - it was a rough life.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Ghostface Killah

quotes.Text: I don't know how to function without music. When I'm not making it, I'm listening to it. It gives me courage and takes care of my mind.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Billie Eilish

quotes.Text: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
quotes.Title: Danish Philosopher
quotes.Name: Soren Kierkegaard

quotes.Text: Anybody whose mind is functioning at all can't be content with the way the world works.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Frederick Wiseman

quotes.Text: Books have this function that help me to understand the work I've done, to wrap it up.
quotes.Title: German Photographer
quotes.Name: Wolfgang Tillmans

quotes.Text: It is the responsibility of the government to ensure the House functions.
quotes.Title: Indian Politician
quotes.Name: Sharad Pawar

quotes.Text: Most importantly, I strive for function above all in every house.
quotes.Title: British Designer
quotes.Name: Hilary Farr
